H0.text: the cuban revolt against spain was led by. Carlos Manuel de Céspedes

H1.text: the cuban revolt against spain was led by. Calixto García

H2.text: the cuban revolt against spain was led by. Antonio Maceo

H3.text: the cuban revolt against spain was led by. José Martí

A4.text: On April 1 and 11, 1895, the main rebel leaders landed on two expeditions in Oriente: Major General Antonio Maceo along with 22 members near Baracoa, and José Martí, Máximo Gómez and four other members in Playitas.

A5.text: Cuban General Calixto García, head of the Mambi forces in the Eastern department, ordered his troops to hold their respective areas.

A6.text: His unification of the Cuban émigré community, particularly in Florida, was crucial to the success of the Cuban War of Independence against Spain.

A7.text: He was a key figure in the planning and execution of this war, as well as the designer of the Cuban Revolutionary Party and its ideology.
